title: Billie Eilish hops in to James Corden’s car as latest Carpool Karaoke star
text:
Billie’s in the passenger seat for the latest James Corden skit (Picture: Backgrid/Getty)

Billie Eilish has become the latest star to hitch a ride with James Corden as she was spotted filming Carpool Karaoke in Los Angeles.

The 17-year-old and the British host were seen talking and laughing as they drove around the city, talking about her music before singing together.

James’s segment for the Late Late Show has become one of the viral hits of his chat series, with stars including Adele, One Direction and Celine Dion all taking part.

It’s not yet known when Billie’s version of will air, or what they’ll be singing from her album, but it’s pretty much a given at this point Bad Guy will at least make an appearance in some way.

Billie’s career has been shooting off over the past year, with her childhood icon Billie Joe Armstrong of Green Day recently announcing that she ‘saves lives’ with her music.

Referring to the time he went to one of Eilish’s shows, he said to her in Rolling Stone: ‘That’s one thing I really liked that you said to your fans when I saw your show. You said something about not having it together.

Billie is the latest Carpool Karaoke star (Picture: Backgrid)

‘You said something about how, “you’re in the right place if you’re crazy.” I think about that a lot, because that’s what a lot of people come home with.’

The American Idiot hitmaker added: ‘A song like Wish You Were Gay, that’s just a rad song, but I think it saves lives — I do.’

Billie Joe and Billie were chatting for the latest edition of Musicians on Musicians series by the landmark magazine, with Elton John and Lana Del Ray also taking part.

The pair will be cruising along to Billie’s greatest hits to date for the video clip (Picture: Backgrid)

Following the release of the Bad Guy hitmaker’s latest album, When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go?, Billie became the youngest ever female solo act to top the charts.

Since then she’s performed at the biggest festivals and events across the world, and has vowed to keep her 2020 tour as eco-friendly as possible in a bid to raise awareness on climate change.

She also became this year’s Halloween costume of choice for fellow celebs including Jameela Jamil, Nina Dobrev and Anne-Marie.
